Pre-Game Insights: Former Black Stars midfielder Emmanuel Agyemang-Badu has expressed confidence in Ghana’s potential to secure victory against Egypt in their second group stage match at the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON).
Agyemang Badu remains optimistic about the Black Stars’ chances against Egypt, despite Egypt’s 2-2 draw against Mozambique and Ghana’s 2-1 defeat to Cape Verde in their respective opening matches.
The former Black Stars midfielder highlighted the importance of coach Chris Hughton’s proper selection for the match against Egypt.

Both teams aim for a crucial victory to enhance their tournament prospects, the upcoming clash promises to be a closely contested and highly anticipated encounter, set to kick off at 8 p.m. on Thursday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Black Stars are scheduled to face the Pharaohs on Thursday, January 18, 2024, in their second group stage match at the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON).
If Ghana loses, it puts them out of the competition, even though there will still be one last match to play against Mozambique.
Others: Agyemang-Badu acknowledged the challenge of the encounter but expressed hope for Ghana’s success with the right preparations.
The upcoming clash promises to be a closely contested and highly anticipated encounter, set to kick off at 8 p.m. on Thursday.
